title: BSA Security and Fire
content:
[BSA Security and Fire](https;//www.bsasecurityandfire.co.uk), formerly known as Broadland Security Alarms, had been a long time customer of Design Solution Ltd (henceforth Dessol). We first built their website more than 10 years ago as a fairly standard PHP website with no framework or CMS (Content Management System). This lack of a CMS meant that whenever a change was required, they had to come to us for an update. What's more, as time went on, the website started to look and feel a little dated.

To help alleviate this issue, BSA Security and Fire and Dessol came to a decision to reinvigorate the website. This would be to both improve the presentation and performance of the website, whilst also allowing them to update it when necessary. To facilitate this, WordPress was utilised using a pre-purchased theme (Trade). New design specifications were brought to us by our designer, and I was tasked with implementing the new website with WordPress.
about:
[BSA Security and Fire](https://www.bsasecurityandfire.co.uk) had been a client of Design Solution (henceforth Dessol) for the better part of 10 years. We built their website when the company was in its infancy as a standard PHP website with no framework or CMS (Content Management System). This lack of a CMS meant that whenever a change was required, they had to come to us for an update. What's more, as time went on, the website started to look and feel a little dated.

To help alleviate this issue, BSA Security and Fire and Dessol decided to reinvigorate the website. This would be to both improve the presentation and performance of the website, whilst also providing our client some autonomy. To facilitate this, WordPress was chosen using a pre-purchased theme (Trade). New design specifications were brought to us by our designer, and I was tasked with implementing it.
